author: CNN Newsource
title: Un hospital en el norte de Gaza dice que ya no puede atender a los heridos
text:
Belén Liotti
(CNN) –– El director de un hospital en el norte de Gaza dijo que ya no pueden hacer frente a la afluencia de personas gravemente heridas y que tuvieron que trasladarlas a otro lugar.
El Dr. Hussam Abu Safiya, director del hospital Kamal Adwan en el norte de Gaza, le dijo a CNN este jueves que civiles gravemente heridos por un ataque aéreo israelí que tuvo lugar el miércoles contra una casa en el área de Beit Lahia no habían podido ser recibidos en el hospital. “Esos casos fueron trasladados a otro hospital por la falta de especialidades necesarias para el manejo de este tipo de lesiones”.
Blinken afirma que Israel aceptó los términos de la retirada de Gaza en una”propuesta puente”, a pesar de dichos de Netanyahu
Muchos hospitales de Gaza carecen de personal y equipos después de diez meses de conflicto y la dificultad de acceso a gran parte de Gaza para las organizaciones de ayuda.
Abu Safiya dijo que había escasez de combustible en Kamal Adwan.
“Ahora estamos trabajando a la capacidad mínima en la prestación de servicios. La cantidad de combustible que tenemos no es suficiente para más de 24 horas”.
Dijo que alrededor de una decena de niños están en diálisis o con ventiladores. “La falta de combustible significa el fin de la vida de estos niños”.
Abu Safiya dijo que el combustible llegaba en “cantidades que apenas alcanzan para unos días”.
Dijo que otro problema era la propagación de enfermedades, ya que los programas de vacunación se retrasaron debido al conflicto.
“Nos han llegado un gran número de enfermedades de la piel e infecciones intestinales (…) Es necesario reactivar las vacunas y tomar las muestras necesarias”.
A principios de este mes, el Ministro de Salud del Gobierno Autónomo Palestino, el Dr. Majed Abu Ramadan, dijo que Gaza estaba “enfrentando un desastre humanitario en todos los sentidos de la palabra. La agresión ha provocado la destrucción de más del 80% de la infraestructura sanitaria y la mayoría de los hospitales están fuera de servicio”.
Recuperan en Gaza los cadáveres de seis rehenes israelíes, según las FDI y la Agencia de Seguridad Israelí
Ramadan dijo que los hospitales operativos “están funcionando parcialmente debido a los daños directos y la pérdida de personal médico calificado como consecuencia del desplazamiento forzado que enfrenta nuestro pueblo, así como a la falta de recursos, cortes de energía, escasez de combustible, falta de agua potable, alcantarillado, inundaciones, acumulación de desechos sólidos y propagación de epidemias”.
El Ministerio de Salud de Gaza informó el primer caso de polio la semana pasada, que atribuyó al desbordamiento de aguas residuales y a la falta de agua potable.
Dijo que “se han completado los preparativos y arreglos para la campaña de vacunación para combatir la polio, dirigida a niños menores de 10 años, y la campaña está esperando la llegada de vacunas a Gaza”.
The-CNN-Wire
™ & © 2024 Cable News Network, Inc., a Warner Bros. Discovery Company. All rights reserved.

author: Eliza Gkritsi
title: X suspends processing of some personal data for AI training – Euractiv
text:
Languages: Français | Deutsch Print Email Facebook X LinkedIn WhatsApp Telegram
Updates This post has been updated to add a post by X's global government affairs team. Social media giant X has suspended the processing of some personal data from EU users’ public posts to train AI models, two days after the Irish Data Protection Commission (DPC) launched court proceedings over the practice.
This was the first time a leading data protection authority had decided to seek a court order to suspend a platform’s data processing activities , the DPC said about it the court proceedings .
Following the court filing, X agreed to suspend the processing of personal data from EU users’ public posts collected between 7 May and 1 August to train the Grok AI model, the DPC said.
The Irish DPC is responsible for overseeing compliance with the EU’s General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) for many Big Tech platforms, as many of their European headquarters are in Dublin.
The timeframe for which the suspension applies relates to X’s request for consent, reported Irish Examiner .
The data processing started on 7 May to train Grok and X gradually introduced an opt-out option for users from 16 July, the judge hearing the case said, according to the Irish Examiner .
X’s suspension will hold until the court decided on the DPC’s request, a lawyer representing X told the Irish newspaper.
Grok is developed by Elon Musk-founded xAI and is a search assistant for premium accounts on the social media platform.
Asked to comment on this story, X pointed Euractiv to a 9 August post from its government affairs team which reads: “We are pleased that people using X in the EU can continue to use Grok and control how their data is used with a simple privacy setting. We will continue to work with the DPC about Grok and other AI matters as we have been doing since last year. ”
In a Tuesday post, the same team said that the court case unfairly singled out X.
“ X directly communicated to users how it uses data to train AI and X’s policies have been updated since 2023 to better reflect that,” the post reads.
Digital rights activists praised the DPC’s decision to take X to court, saying it showed the authority appeared to have turned a new page on enforcement under new leadership.
The Irish DPC had engaged extensively with X on the issue prior to filing the court case, the data watchdog said.
On Monday (5 August), consumer groups alleged that X was in breach of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), the EU’s landmark data protection law, in a complaint filed with the Irish DPC .
In June, Meta similarly halted plans to train AI models with the personal data of EU users from public posts, following data protection complaints .
[Edited by Daniel Eck]
Read more with Euractiv UK competition authority launches merger inquiry into Amazon-Anthropic partnership The UK's main competition watchdog has formally opened an investigation into the merger between Amazon and AI company Anthropic, a statement released on Thursday (8 August) reads.

author: Megan Soldano
title: Reviving The Classics: How Traditional Games Find New Life Online
text:
In an age dominated by advanced video games and VR experiences, a surprising trend is emerging: classic games, once staples of family game nights and casual pastimes, are experiencing a renaissance in the digital realm.
From
Solitaire to other beloved classics, these games are being rejuvenated online, attracting new generations of players and reconnecting older ones with their nostalgic favorites.
This article explores how several classic games are finding new life in the online world.
Solitaire: A Digital Makeover
Solitaire, long known as a staple game on personal computers, has seen a remarkable transformation in the online world.
This classic card game, beloved by many for its simplicity and challenge, has been rejuvenated on digital platforms, reaching a wider and more diverse audience than ever before.
Variety of Versions
The transition to online has introduced a plethora of Solitaire variants, far beyond the traditional Klondike most are familiar with.
Versions like Spider, where the goal is to create eight sequences of the same suit, and FreeCell, known for its open-cell feature that requires more strategic moves, offer fresh challenges.
Each variant maintains the core essence of Solitaire while providing unique twists and increased complexity.
Advanced Features and Interactive Gameplay
Digital platforms have infused Solitaire with a range of interactive and engaging features. Daily challenges offer new puzzles every day, keeping the game fresh and exciting.
Worldwide leaderboards introduce a competitive element, enabling players to benchmark their scores and track their progress against others from around the globe.
Some platforms even incorporate multiplayer options, transforming Solitaire from a solitary experience into a social one where players can compete or cooperate with friends or strangers online.
Personalization of Visuals and Gameplay
Digital Solitaire offers the flexibility for players to tailor the game’s visual elements to their liking.
This personalization includes options to modify card styles and backdrops, as well as the ability to alter the game’s challenge level.
Such customization not only enriches the player’s experience but also makes the game more engaging, as it can be adapted to suit personal preferences and playing styles.
Board Games Embrace The Online World
The digital era has ushered in a new life for classic board games, transforming them from physical tabletop experiences to interactive online adventures.
This digital revolution has not only preserved the essence of these traditional games but has also expanded their reach and appeal.
Transition to Online Platforms
Iconic board games like Monopoly, Scrabble, and Risk have made a seamless transition to digital platforms.
This shift has involved adapting the physical elements of these games into virtual formats, ensuring that the core gameplay remains true to the original.
By going digital, these games have become more accessible to a broader audience, breaking down barriers related to physical game sets and geographical location.
Enhanced Features and Gameplay
The digital versions of these classic board games often include enhanced features that are not possible in their physical counterparts.
For instance, Monopoly in its digital form can offer animated interactions, various board themes, and automated bank transactions.
Scrabble enthusiasts can enjoy features like built-in dictionaries and AI opponents. Risk, known for its strategic military conquests, benefits from streamlined gameplay and improved user interfaces in its online version.
Online Multiplayer and Connectivity
A key benefit of digital board games is their capability to facilitate remote play.
The online multiplayer feature enables players to engage with friends and family, playing together seamlessly from different locations, thus overcoming the barriers of geographical distance.
This feature has been particularly valuable in maintaining social connections through gaming, especially during times when in-person interactions are limited.
Customizable Rules and Settings
Digital board games often provide the flexibility to modify rules and settings, allowing players to customize their gaming experience.
This level of customization can range from altering the game’s difficulty to implementing house rules, making the games more adaptable to different player preferences and skill levels.
Preservation and Nostalgia
The digitization of board games also plays a crucial role in preserving these classics for future generations.
It introduces these games to younger audiences who might be more inclined towards digital gaming.
Additionally, it offers a sense of nostalgia for those who grew up playing these games in their traditional form.
Conclusion: Classics Reimagined For The Future
The digital revival of classic games signifies a shift in gaming culture. It highlights a growing appreciation for simplicity and strategy over flashy graphics and fast-paced action.
These games evoke a nostalgic feeling, serving as a reminder that often, the most straightforward games stand the test of time and remain the most cherished.
The shift of traditional games to online formats showcases their enduring charm and their capacity to adapt to changing times and technologies.
By embracing the digital age, these games have not only preserved their legacy but also expanded their reach to a broader audience.
As technology continues to evolve, it’s clear that classic games like Solitaire will continue to be cherished, offering endless enjoyment to players old and new.

author: 11Alive Staff
title: Ellijay tornado preliminary EF-1 reported | 11alive.com
text: ELLIJAY, Ga. — Preliminary results from a National Weather Service survey in Ellijay on Friday show EF-1 tornado damage in the area. Ellijay and the wider Gilmer County area were hit especially hard as storms [swept through the area](/article/weather/severe-weather-updates-atlanta/85-37818b8b-010f-4dce-804c-3999fc61cfa9) late Wednesday night and early Thursday morning. An EF-1 tornado would mean max winds of 90-100 miles per hour impacted the area. The 11Alive SkyTracker flew over the scene on Friday, showing buildings with walls and roofs blown away, trailers that had been completely wrecked and large trees that had fallen. The National Weather Service crew will continue to survey the Ellijay area and will also at some point observe Walker County, where it was possible a tornado touched down. News happens fast. Stream it faster with our re-designed 11Alive+ app. Watch newscasts, breaking news streams and get the latest sports, weather and VERIFY content -- 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. Available on [Roku, Apple TV and Amazon Fire TV](/watch). Text "plus" to 404-885-7600 to download 11Alive+ and stream now.

author: financialcontent.com
title: Career Development Solutions Wraps Up Successful "Counselor Day" Event Series | FinancialContent Business Page
text:
ANAHEIM, Calif. - Feb. 29, 2024 - PRLog -- Career Development Solutions, LLC, a leading provider of IT and tech career training, is excited to announce the successful conclusion of its recent "Counselor Day" event series, held across six of its training center locations. The events provided attendees with an exclusive behind-the-scenes look at their newly updated training spaces, fostering valuable networking opportunities and professional development sessions.
The "Counselor Day" series welcomed counselors from local workforce centers and partner agencies to explore the rebranded facilities, enjoy networking conversations over coffee and continental breakfast with other agency representatives and partake in a dynamic Tips & Tricks session aimed at boosting productivity using Excel and Outlook.
Attendees had the opportunity to:
Explore Newly Updated Training Spaces : Visitors were given an insider's look at the redesigned training facilities, equipped with state-of-the-art amenities to enhance the learning experience. Connect Over Coffee & Continental Breakfast : The event facilitated meaningful networking opportunities, allowing counselors, professionals and the Career Development Solutions team to connect and exchange insights in a relaxed setting. Participate in Productivity Workshops : A highlight of the Open House series was the Tips & Tricks session led by Career Development Solutions' top-rated instructors. Attendees gained practical insights on Microsoft Office and Excel and firsthand experience of what students experience when they attend class at an in-person branch location. The events were held at Career Development Solutions training center locations in Anaheim, Burbank, Las Vegas, Sacramento, San Diego and Tucson, and provided an immersive experience for participants, enabling them to interact directly with the training environment and experience the quality of education offered to students.
"We are thrilled with the positive response to our Counselor Day series because we love hosting our partners in our training center locations," said Cindy Sutherland, President at Career Development Solutions. "These gatherings allowed us to showcase our commitment to providing top-tier training facilities and resources to our community of learners. We are grateful to all who joined us to make this series successful."
Career Development Solutions extends its appreciation to all attendees, partners and supporters who contributed to the success of the "Counselor Day" series, and applauds all team members whose preparation and hard work ensured a fulfilling event for all involved.
Career Development Solutions has consistently demonstrated its commitment to empowering individuals with the technical skills and industry-recognized credentials needed to re-enter the workforce successfully or change career paths to enter the world of IT and tech. Learn more at www.careerdevelopmentsolutions.com .
Contact
Terry Mott, Client Success Specialist
Career Development Solutions
***@careerdevelopmentsolutions.com
 Career Development Solutions
Read Full Story - Career Development Solutions Wraps Up Successful "Counselor Day" Event Series

author: India Today World Desk
title: Israel-Hamas war: UN says 'everyone in Gaza is hungry' as Palestinian aid agency faces potential shutdown - India Today
text: United Nations Secretary-General Antsup3nio Guterres on Thursday made an urgent plea for immediate and sustained humanitarian access to the Gaza Strip highlighting how quoteveryone in Gaza was hungryquotIn a social media post he wrote quotEveryone in Gaza is hungry 17 million people have been displaced The humanitarian system in collapsing I call for rapid safe unhindered expanded and sustained humanitarian access throughout GazaquotGuterres highlighted the severe conditions in Gaza saying that there was a collapse of the humanitarian systemIn another post on X the UN chief said that only a two-State solution could ensure the realisation of rights of the Palestian people and peace in the regionquotOnly the two-State solution ndash with Israel Palestine living side-by-side ndash can ensure the realisation of the inalienable rights of the Palestinian people and a just lasting peace in the region The international community must not waver in its commitment to that solutionquot Guterres saidMeanwhile on Wednesday Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu urged the closure of the UN Palestinian Refugee Agency UNRWA simultaneous with ongoing Israeli air strikes in Gaza amid diplomatic attempts for a ceasefire and the release of hostagesIsrael alleges UNRWA staff involvement in the October 7 Hamas assault prompting a freeze on funding by donors including the United States pending an investigation However aid agencies argue that discontinuing UNRWA operations would severely impact humanitarian efforts in GazaThe UNRWA said on Thursday that it will most likely be forced to shut down its operations in the Middle East including in Gaza by the end of the month if funding does not resume according to a Reuters reportAfter Hamas039 October 7 assault on Israel causing approximately 1140 casualties mainly civilians as per an AFP count relying on official data the Israeli military initiated a fierce air land and sea offensiveThe Gaza health ministry reports that this offensive has killed at least 26900 individuals consisting of mainly women and childrenPublished By Aditi SharmaPublished On Feb 2 2024Tune InALSO READ lsquoIndia backs humanitarian aid to Gaza wants two-state solutionrsquo PM ModiMust Watch
